etymologies: mid 16th century: via Latin from Greek arkhetupon ‘something moulded first as a model’, from arkhe- ‘primitive’ + tupos ‘a model’

definitions: a very typical example of a certain person or thing

examples.text: he was the archetype of the old-style football club chairman

shortDefinitions: very typical example of certain person or thing

definitions: an original which has been imitated; a prototype

examples.text: an instrument which was the archetype of the early flute

definitions: (in Jungian theory) a primitive mental image inherited from the earliest human ancestors, and supposed to be present in the collective unconscious.
shortDefinitions: (in Jungian theory) primitive mental image inherited from earliest human ancestors

definitions: a recurrent symbol or motif in literature, art, or mythology

examples.text: mythological archetypes of good and evil

shortDefinitions: recurrent symbol or motif in literature or mythology
